DOC.brief_summary: Hypothesis : Vitamin D serum concentration decrease first trimester pregnant woman develop preeclampsia second third trimester compare control group Primary purpose : To determine vitamin D status first trimester large population french pregnant woman order evaluate importance vitamin D deficiency France correlate deficiency preeclampsia
DOC.detailed_description: Primary purpose : To compare vitamin D ( 25OHD ) status , first trimester , group patient preeclampsia group pregnant woman without preeclampsia . Secondary purpose : ( ) To compare vitamin D status third trimester group patient preeclampsia group pregnant woman without preeclampsia . ( ii ) To evaluate deficit un vitamin D population pregnant woman parisian area . ( iii ) To evaluate calcemia newborn maternal systematic oral intake vitamin D 100000U 28 week Methodology : Multicenter ( 6 center ) , Cohort , Nested case-control study Protocol : 4500 patient recruit . A blood sample perform : first trimester ( 11-14 week ) , third trimester ( 28-40 week ) , cord blood . For patient preeclampsia , 4 control take cohort match parity , race/ethnicity , maternal age , season , BMI . The serum concentration 25OHD measure samples.A dosage 25OHD performed 1000 woman initial cohort order calculate prevalence vitamin D deficiency .
DOC.criteria: Pregnant woman First trimester Singleton Affiliated Social security policy Woman give inform consent Hypercalcemia ( > 2.65 mmol/l ) phosphocalcic disease Hypertension ( > 140/90 ) first trim Renal insufficiency ( creatinine > 120µmol/l ) Bone disease ( osteogenesis imperfecta… ) Lithium therapy Bowel malabsorption Kidney stone
